cards.back: Version control system tracking code changes over time. See what changed and when, go back to any version, work on features safely, collaborate. When talking to LLMs: "Commit these changes" or "Undo the last commit"

A snapshot of code at a point in time with a message. git add . then git commit -m "Add login". Each has unique ID, message, author, timestamp. When talking to LLMs: "Create a commit for this feature"

A separate line of development. Work on features without affecting main code. main = stable, feature branch = work in progress. Create, make changes, merge back. When talking to LLMs: "Create a branch for this feature"

A request to merge changes into another branch. Allows review before merging. Create branch → make changes → push → open PR → review → merge. When talking to LLMs: "Create a PR description for these changes"

When Git can't auto-combine changes because two people edited same lines. Shows <<<< HEAD, your version, ====, their version, >>>>. Must manually resolve. When talking to LLMs: "Help me resolve this merge conflict"

npm: Node Package Manager installs JS libraries. package.json: lists your dependencies. npm install gets everything listed. npm install axios adds new package. When talking to LLMs: "Add axios to dependencies"

Tool checking code for errors and style issues without running it. Catches unused variables, missing semicolons, potential bugs. ESLint (JS), Pylint (Python). When talking to LLMs: "Fix the linter errors"
Code testing a small piece of your code works. test('adds numbers', () => { expect(add(2,3)).toBe(5) }). When talking to LLMs: "Write unit tests for this function"
Finding and fixing bugs. Techniques: console.log to see values, debugger to step through code, read error messages carefully. When talking to LLMs: "Help me debug this - it returns undefined"
List showing the path code took to reach an error. Read bottom to top to find where error happened. When talking to LLMs: "Here's the stack trace" - paste it to help identify the issue

Improving code structure without changing what it does. Goals: easier to read, less duplication, better performance. Tests should pass before and after. When talking to LLMs: "Refactor this to be more readable"
Text interface to control computer by typing commands. cd (go to folder), ls (list files), mkdir (create folder). When talking to LLMs: "What terminal command do I run?"
Integrated Development Environment - program for writing code with helpful features. Syntax highlighting, auto-complete, error detection, debugging. VS Code, WebStorm, PyCharm.
File listing what Git should NOT track. Common: node_modules/, .env (secrets), *.log, .DS_Store. When talking to LLMs: "Add .env to gitignore"
Converting source code to production-ready form. May compile TypeScript, bundle files, minify code, optimize images. npm run build. When talking to LLMs: "The build is failing"

Auto-updating app when you save code without manual refresh. Dev server watches files → detects changes → updates browser. When talking to LLMs: "Set up hot reloading" or "Changes aren't showing after saving"

File storing environment variables and secrets. DATABASE_URL, API_KEY, etc. Never commit to Git - add to .gitignore. Create .env.example with dummy values. When talking to LLMs: "Store the API key in .env"
Messages your app writes to record what's happening. Levels: DEBUG (detailed), INFO (general), WARN (unexpected), ERROR (failed). When talking to LLMs: "Add logging to track errors"
Having others look at your code before merging. Check for bugs, style, security, performance, tests. When talking to LLMs: "Review this code for issues"
Version numbering: MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH. 2.4.1 means breaking changes (2), new features (4), bug fixes (1). ^2.4.1 accepts 2.x.x. When talking to LLMs: "This is breaking - bump major version"
